author: Syed Muthahar Saqaf
text:
The crippled arms did not deter 17-year-old M. Mahesh from pursuing Plus Two.

He has set a worthy example for the entire youth community by writing the Plus Two examinations with his toes, holding the pen between the fingers of his left leg at the Government Boys Higher Secondary School, Komarapalayam town.

Mahesh, a native of Kodipalli village in Krishnagiri district, was born with crippled hands. He lost his mother just after his birth. He lost his father Manjanatha at the age of six.

Mahesh was very much disappointed, but not disheartened. His grandmother Parvathi of Salem took care of him and admitted him at Nehru Memorial Sampoorani Ammal Higher Secondary School for differently abled at Ethirmedu in Komarapalayam. At the school, he was imparted specialised training in writing using toes.

Mahesh came out successful in the SSLC public examinations in 2013-14. Mahesh is confident that he will secure high marks in the Plus Two examinations. He says that he will decide his future course of studies depending on the marks he get in the Plus Two.
title: This 17-year-old uses toes to write exams
